results.title: Testament: The Bible and history
results.creator_credit: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description: John Romer, an emminent archaelogist, undertakes a personal quest to examine the history of the Bible. He explores its origins and evolution through time as a rare and valuable sacred text, to a modern day paperback best seller available to the masses. Romer does not set out to discredit or disprove the literal truth of the Bible, but to examine how this influential text has shaped the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films

results.title: Power and glory
results.creator_credit: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Virtually the sole source of learning in the western Dark Ages, the Bible’s character’s and stories were used to justify the social order and to offer its citizens security in this world and the next. After the fall of the Roman Empire, Christianity was nurtured in small settlements places like Ireland and Scotland. From these monastries came the most beautiful illuminated manuscripts of Bible text. Charlemagne restored Christianity to its glory and feudal society mirrored that of the Bible with its emphasis on order and place. Also features a close look at the ancient Byzantine church of Haiga Sophia in Istanbul.

results.title: Thine is the kingdom
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Christianity becomes the religion of the Roman Empire and Palestine becomes a sacred landscape. The Bible and church rituals are decorated with the trappings of Imperial power. The Emperor Constantine becomes the first Christian Emperor of Rome and the division between secular and temporal authority is made more apparent when the concept of the Holy Trinity is adopted in the Nicean Creed. Saint Jerome’s translation of the Bible into Latin from Greek makes it a more accessible text.

results.title: Telling tales
results.brief_description:
Telling Tales are real stories told and produced by people with a disability and those who are disadvantaged.

Telling Tales challenges the ‘norms’ as often represented by mainstream film with first person accounts that provide a real opportunity to be seen and heard. The stories explore personal journeys of identity, displacement, relationships, longing and memory.

Telling Tales was produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: 'Remembrance of things past'...a watercolour memoir for Richard
results.brief_description: When Judith recalls Richard’s legacy, she sees it through his watercolour paintings that stand as a aesthetic record to his life, from his childhood to his adult academic pursuits.
